body:
can't reproduce this on my master and stable5 installation with your image. it however takes ages (15mins) for me to load your link in chromium 31.0.1605.0 (and the picture doesn't show then) and it hangs konqueror 4.11.0, yet it works in firefox 23.0.

furthermore use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md) please.

### expected behaviour
chrome browser should open shared file/image without any problems.

### actual behaviour
loading of the shared file page takes ages or does not load either and chrome reports that the page is unresponsive.
if i try to access this owncloud in different tab/browser during the shared page loading, it is stuck too. it starts to work again when i close the problem tab.

### steps to reproduce
1. load an image to owncloud
2. share that image with link
3. open the link in chrome web browser

### server configuration
operating system:
ubuntu 10.04.4 lts

web server:
`apache2 -version`
server version: apache/2.2.14 (ubuntu)
server built:   jul 12 2013 13:39:34

database:
`mysql --version`
mysql  ver 14.14 distrib 5.1.70, for debian-linux-gnu (x86_64) using readline 6.1

php version:
`php --version`
php 5.3.2-1ubuntu4.20 with suhosin-patch (cli) (built: jul 15 2013 17:10:50) 
copyright (c) 1997-2009 the php group
zend engine v2.3.0, copyright (c) 1998-2010 zend technologies

owncloud version:
owncloud 5.0.10

### client configuration
browser:
chrome (29.0.1547.57) or chromium

operating system:
does not matter

### logs
#### web server error log
error log is empty

access log:
```

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
```
{"app":"php","message":"directive 'register_long_arrays' is deprecated in php 5.3 and greater at unknown#0","level":4,"time":"2013-08-28t09:06:05+00:00"}
```

#### browser log
chrome console is empty
i'm facing the same problem - owncloud is 5.0.10 running on debian wheezy. browser is chrome 29.0.1547.62.

facing the same problem. loading a shared pic takes ages, than chrome says that page is not responding, i click "wait", than no pic loaded, but still can download it using "download" link to the right. if i share a folder - no problems with that. with other browsers works fine.

### expected behaviour
shared picture should be visible to a client

### actual behaviour
it takes ages for chrome to load a pic and then fails, but pic is still downloadable

### steps to reproduce
1.  share a single pic with a link (may include password or not)
2. use the link to access the pic
3. profit

### server configuration
operating system: centos release 6.4 (final) running on proxmox virtual host with 2.6.32-20-pve as openvz virtual guest.
ram: 1 gb

web server:  apache/2.2.15 (unix)

database: separate server with mysql, as virtual guest on proxmox, on debian6, 5.1.63-0+squeeze1

php version:
php 5.4.20 (cli) (built: sep 18 2013 19:59:56)
copyright (c) 1997-2013 the php group
zend engine v2.4.0, copyright (c) 1998-2013 zend technologies

owncloud version:
5.0.11	(up to date)

### client configuration
browser:
chrome version 29.0.1547.76 
chromium, that comes with debian7
operating system: win7, debian7

### logs
#### web server error log
``` 
does not seem to be related, but: 
error	 search_lucene	 need mimetype for content extraction	 2013-09-28t13:08:59+00:00

#### browser log
```
1) javascript console:
uncaught referenceerror: files is not defined public.js?v=b28d7c6b6aec04f5525b453411ff4336:66
failed to load resource https://romanr.eu/owncloud/public.php?service=files&t=61a5278c938e1213def03f2a191c927f&download

get https://romanr.eu/owncloud/public.php?service=files&t=61a5278c938e1213def03f2a191c927f&download  public.php:5
```

```
  // cancel upload trigger
  $('#cancel_upload_button').click(files.canceluploads);
uncaught refereceerror: files is not defined
```
### example link:
https://romanr.eu/owncloud/public.php?service=files&t=61a5278c938e1213def03f2a191c927f

hey,
update: seems to be an issue only for pics that are larger..
https://romanr.eu/owncloud/public.php?service=files&t=299ab790894347c97c09182d91e65545
this works. 2,2 mb
hm, not working any more also. but worked just a moment ago.
fix it pls

just got this as well in oc6 alpha 2 (master) on chrome 30.
not sure what the exact conditions are. recently i fiddled with the max zip download option.
will try and debug this.

firefox doesn't have any issues. weird.

works with a text file.
seems to be only happening for bigger pics (mine has 2.8 mb)
small pic works (5.3 kb)

for some reason apps/files_sharing/public.php is called twice. the second one hangs and doesn't reach the end.
when i debug step by step, both calls finish correctly and the image appears.
must be some wicked race condition :sweat:

looks like the second call is calling "download" to get the image preview, and it hangs there.
getting closer :mag_right:

i traced it down to lib/private/files/view.php:200 function readfile()
it seems to hang on fread() after reading more than 2 mb.
the value on which it hangs on seems to be > 2mb most of the time but is different every time.
cc @icewind1991 @tanghus in case you have any clue

i've split fread() from echo and found out that it's actually the "echo" part that outputs the block that hangs.
i suspect that the browser isn't correctly reading its side of the data for some reason and php is waiting before putting more data into the socket.
looking further...

in the log i've output the number of bytes sent. in my case it was 2490368
at the same time i enabled chrome debugging and stripped out the messages about loading this file's data. the sum is 520192
the last block sizes read by chrome are:
...
8192
8192
8192
16384
32768
12288

i suspect this might be a chrome bug of some sort.

i have chromium version 30.0.1553.0 (209444) running on opensuse 12.3.
php version is php5-5.3.17-3.4.1.i586

increasing the block size from 8192 to 65536 (view.php) fixes the problem
for at least files around 3-4 mb.


2013/10/17 vincent petry <notifications@github.com>

> i have chrome version 30.0.1553.0 (209444) running on opensuse 12.3.
> php version is php5-5.3.17-3.4.1.i586
>
> â€”
> reply to this email directly or view it on github<https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/4545#issuecomment-26517168>
> .
>

i tried upgrading to chromium version 31.0.1650.11 (226662) but the issue still happens.
so weird...
does it have to be an image? i can't reproduce it with another 20 mb file, and i don't have images > ~ 1 mb.

it has to be an image at least 2 mb big. i haven't tried with bigger ones.
it could be an environment issue.

i'll have some test while having chrome running on different systems but pointing at my server and see what happens.
i managed to find a 35 mb jpeg. works like a charm both with preview and download.
sry, apparently didn't read that it has to be a public link...

we just tried looking at the apache2 mod_status console and it looks like all buffers are full, it's blocking on write.
we tried without flush(), with ob_flush(). no success.

in case it helps, i have apache2-2.2.22-10.8.1.i586
@karlitschek suggested to try and see how it behaves when the memory is full, in case it's a buffer overflow thing...

people, i've tried disabling all apps and left only "versions" and "sharing". the problem still occurs.
and then after disabling "versions", poof, it works!
if i re-enable "versions" it's broken again.
wow this is so crazy. versions should do nothing for reading files.
must be some kind of weird side effect.

oh my. thanks. really helped. as i dont really need the versioning, i've disabled it also and poof, works. 
but keep this up to date please. i'll re-enable it as soon as fixed.

@romeor thanks for the confirmation that it also works on your side.

i've just switched to another computer which has the same env (opensuse
12.3 + same apache version, etc) and the problem also happens.

i'll try to strip down every bit until i find what is causing this.

stay tuned ;-)
now that i really call a spirit. never seen such an activity of software community. thanks. any help (as much as i can) from me is always available.

awwwwaargghh !!!! (oops, sorry...) 

it's the ajax sync call from t() that causes this (the translation text). ajax calls should never be made in a synchronous way because they hang the browser. i guess that some race condition is probably causing this sync call to mess up with the one from the image.

this is bad news, because it means that this bug can potentially pop up anywhere else where such conditions are met.

i think we need to fix the js translation calls once for all. there's still a todo there to make it async, but it might be much more work.

i'll try to find a workaround for this.

it's in apps/files_versions/js/versions.js line 7.

i'll disable this code for single file view as it makes no sense to init this when no file list is shown.
